captions.text: Show me a stranger
and I'll show you a friend that you haven't met yet.
Because the obstacle in the way of anything
is usually just one of the prices of success.
And people are more than numbers.
To crack a smile is really no stress.
Divide my time like economics,
I love to say "Hi" and "Bye" less.
Multiply first impressions by everything you might have guessed.
Prejudice takes time
but my time is business.
And this just makes big dollars and sense.
Why would you hate when love just costs less?
In fact, the muscles it takes to make a frown
make more work than to just turn it upside-down.
But you hate it when I'm polite.
Can't stand when I'm sincere.
Call me all these names. Wondering why I'm still just standing here?
Mainly because your ignorance leads me to believe
that you really just need a hug. (Laughter)
And I've been public enemy number one
ever since I learned to kill them with love.
I am a psychotic serial lover.
Seriously considering only complimenting our mothers,
because whether you like it or not,
I am your brother.
A teddy bear terrorist chilling with
my well-mannered crew.
Yeah, you're a racist but I'm gonna still hold the door open for you.
'Cause seriously, dude, ain't no need for the attitude
and I ain't mad at you, I had bad days too.
Here's my celly. Let's talk. I'm a great listener too.
Family driving you crazy, man, and I know I ain't do.
Let me know. I love kids, I can be a babysitter too.
Yeah, boy, 'cause I'm nice like that.
I even watch your car if you promise that you'll be right back.
So relax and be cool.
Ain't no point in lying to you.
I am a servant and my master sees all that I do.
So tell me what you need, dude.
A dollar? Here, take two.
Achoo! May a lord bless you, guide you, and make things easy for you.
This respect thing is just what I do.
And it's past tolerating. It's on the path
of understanding and appreciating you.
So tell me what you're gonna do
when the love come for you?
Insult my heritage? We're both from Adam and Eve, fool!
Oh, snap! How you like that?
You gave me extra change and I gave it right back.
I let people pass when they wanna switch lanes
'Cause if it was me, I hope they'd do the same.
You butchered my name but this is OK.
It happens all the time.
I won't correct it anyways.
And it may sound strange but I'm a beat at change.
Improve every day to prove their rudeness is lame.
I believe in modesty and try to lower my gaze,
and if everything is from above than everything is the same.
I ain't impressed by money, cars, clothes, or fame.
I am a Muslim, so the trinkets of this world don't mean a thing.
I was taught that peace is not the absence of war.
But peace is a feeling that can only come
from remembering your Lord so for the sake of peace
there's no point in hating me anymore.
It's a big place. We can all live together in this world.
I invite you all to join me in this jihad of love,
and see first hand why
fundamentalism still begins with fun.
(Laughter)
And if you don't agree
I won't even judge.
I just kill you all
with love.
(Applause)(Cheers)
(Music)

comments.author: Lestrangekidd93

comments.text:
Loudlightning3, I appreciatie the fact that you stay very polite and that 
you carefully lay out why you say the things you say. I understand with 
your background that you are more inclined to say that religious people are 
judgemental. However, I still urge you not to generalize it. Try to give 
other religious people a chance by giving them the benefit of the doubt. 
Dont expect them to judge you right away,  merely on the basis that they 
consider themselves as part of a certain religion. There are many people, 
and i can also say that out of experience, that do not follow their 
religion very dogmatically. There are people with alternative views and 
people who interpret their scriptures differently. Especially within islam, 
there is a tremendous amout of diversity around the world and within 
communities as well. Especailly since there is no authority within Islam. 
Nobody defines who is a muslim, and who is not. Some might claim there is 
only 1 way to be a muslim, but you will surely find many who disagree as 
well. This is both a strength and a weakness in my opinion. Again 
loudlightning, I understand where you are coming from and I respect the way 
you reply me.
comments.author: Joshboston

comments.text:
+Joshboston I agree with what your saying about how we can't know about ALL 
religious people and if they are secretly judging everybody else. But in 
truth that is just a fact that is used in favor of those people from a 
standpoint of statistics. There are far too many people who believe in 
religion to say that EVERY one of them has this opinion of non-believers 
because it is statistically improbable so I will give you that.

However, with my experiences I can bring to you evidence that cannot be 
proven online but clearly supports my claim of these people judging others. 
I have a religious background, my parents are super religious and so are my 
grandparents and so on. I know the inner workings of a religious family so 
I can tell you, with my experience, that these people judge you.

Now of course you can say that my family's religion is just one out of the 
many religions, but lets take a step back and examine what religion is. 
Remember, no matter what the religion is they all have a common theme. Do 
this, don't do that, feel this, don't feel that, believe in this, don't 
worry about that and you will be granted eternal life/saving/salvation/ 
whatever else your aiming for. Think of all the major religions and tell me 
which one doesn't vaguely follow those guidelines?

A religion is not a way of life, those two things are separate. A way of 
life is different than a religion because a way of life doesn't tell you 
what your suppose to do. Those who live a certain way don't judge others, 
unless their way of life is to judge others lol.... But religion tells you 
exactly what to do and what not to do.

Those who are religious DO judge those who do not have a religion or who 
have a different belief simply because religious people are foreign to any 
ideas that arise from areas that are not sourced from the same place as 
their beliefs. In other words, if you don't agree with them on what they 
believe, then they will judge you based on what you believe. I may not have 
any evidence that has been published in any journal of science or such but 
what I do have are my own experiences. Learn from them as you may, but know 
that you will have to do your own research and have your own experiences 
with these people to know the truth, I am just a messenger conveying my 
thoughts..
comments.author: Loudlightning3

comments.text:
+Loudlightning3 Thank you for your reply. Anybody who claims that you need 
to believe in a deity to live a life in a certain way is, in my opinion, 
wrong. I think we both agree on that. However, i do think you make some 
arguable statements. When you say that religious people are ''secretly 
juding you'', that statement is based on nothing,  except some assumption 
you have. It's a statement that you could only make if you met every single 
religious person on earth, and if you would know them very well, and even 
then it would be hard to make that statement.  Regarding this man, I really 
do not think he believes you HAVE to be religious in order to be the way he 
describes. I think the message he is trying to get across is just that as a 
muslim, he believes he is commanded to act this way. But again, this is the 
impression i got from this speach. We wouldnt know unless we ask him. (and 
even when we ask him, it is possible that what he tells us, is not what he 
is ACTUALLY trying to accomplish)
comments.author: Joshboston

comments.text:
+Joshboston I simply said that I don't see why anybody has to follow a 
religion in order to live the way that this man has explained in this 
video. He referenced his religion when he was doing his talk and that was 
what led me to comment.

You said you didn't think that anybody claimed that a person has to believe 
in something in order to live life a certain way, but thats wrong. That is 
why mentioned religion. Because if you are religious, then you believe in 
something and you think that you must believe in order to "be saved" and 
any other form of that. That is why when it comes to religious people, you 
are either with them or not. They are bias in how they look at you. They 
might not show it upfront, but they are judging you secretly because you 
are ether a non believer or you believe in something else.

This man in the video used religion to get his point across about living 
life in a certain way, is it hard to see that his opinion might be alittle 
bias? Despite if he said was truthful or not, does one really need to bring 
religion into the conversation?
comments.author: Loudlightning3

comments.text: Sorry, did you maybe mean to ask me what the point of religion is?
comments.author: Joshboston

comments.text:
A religion is a system of rituals and stories to communicate to a higher 
power. These stories and rituals enable others within a community to also 
communicate with eachother. But the definition of religion is not important 
here. You were bringing up the question: "why does one have to believe in 
an almighty deity to act the way this guy describes." Well, you don't. You 
can act in whatever way you want, without believing in an almighty deity.
comments.author: Joshboston

comments.text: +Joshboston Um.. then what do you call religion?

built by Abrahim and Ishmael}], The pilgrimage to Makkah for those who are 
able. ﻿

comments.text:

by Edison Electric Company. Thomas Edison was an abjuring atheist and a

Thomas Edison is a real prophet because his design predictions can be

comments.text:
+BarbaAtra Kucher 
Prejudice is a term that applies to one who "pre"-judges, or judges without 
content or substance or knowledge beforehand.

I do not chose my positions on critiques loosely. I have no opinion on the 
doctrine of Buddhism, Janism, Shintoism, Hinduism, etc...

Islam is a different story. Under Sharia law, I am subject to execution for 
being an atheist. Atheists are to be executed as apostates.

To an unbeliever, the Koran reads like Mein Kampf. I see people from the 
middle east in a positive light. They have a history that is far far older 
than Islam. Islam, as a doctrine, I do not view in a positive light, but 
see it as an existential threat.
comments.author: CHAS1422

comments.text:
+CHAS1422 Scribes? You must be ill with that dope you smokin. Get a life 
for ALLAH's sake. There are more things to life than your prejudice against 
Islam.
comments.author: Kore Kucher (Zedki)

comments.text:
+BarbaAtra Kucher I copy and paste because scribes are far too expensive.

Why is criticism always labeled as "phobia"? All doctrines can and should 
be read critically, not out of "fear" but out of honesty. Calling a 
referenced criticism a "phobia" is a form of denial and diversion.
comments.author: CHAS1422

comments.text:
+CHAS1422 Why do you copy and past? I am not gonna read your Islamophobic 
and racist comment.
comments.author: Kore Kucher (Zedki)

comments.text:
+BarbaAtra Kucher Then by your definition of "race" the unbeliever is a 
race as as well. We unbelievers need to have a holy book that mirrors the 
Koran. It will be called the noraK and it will have the following verses:

noraK: 8:55: "Surely the vilest of animals in God's sight are Muslims"

noraK:8:65 "O Prophet, urge the faithful to fight. If there are twenty 
among you with determination they will vanquish two hundred; if there are a 
hundred then they will slaughter a thousand Muslims, for the Muslims are a 
people devoid of understanding." 

noraK:8:39 "So fight them until there is no more Islam and all submit to 
the another religion and Islam is destroyed (in the whole world)." 

noraK:9:5 "Fight and kill the Muslims wherever you find them, take them 
captive, harass them, lie in wait and ambush them using every stratagem of 
war." 

noraK:9:29 "Fight those Muslims who believe until they all surrender, 
paying the extortion tax in submission." 

noraK:9:123 "Fight the Muslims around you, and let them find harshness in 
you." 

That is how we view your Koran (in reverse), and the narratives in the 
Hadith confirm the doctrine.

So if you believe Islam is a race defined by your Koran, then you are a 
bigotted and racist person, and I would have no problem defending against 
you as an existential threat.

Please do not define Islam as a race, for the benefit of those who want to 
assimilate into western society. For me, Islam the doctrine is an 
existential threat to my culture and my way of life. I want to be 
accommodating to immigrant Muslims, but I see VERY clearly how religious 
minorities are treated in Islamic majority countries. 

The silence of the Byzantine Christians, the Afghanistan Buddhists, the 
Pakistani Hindus, the Zoroastrian Persians all speak very loudly in my new 
holy book.
comments.author: CHAS1422
